intro: Ruellia pallida, commonly known as pale ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a pale green color. Its flowers are tubular with five petals, often displaying shades of white, pink, or purple. Ruellia pallida thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
